name: Orphidia
slogan: Universal Platform For All Blood Tests
description:
Orphidia is leading the development of next generation medical technology transforming medical testing and the healthcare industry. 

We are developing a marketplace platform for on-demand lab tests. Our portable blood diagnostic platform can provide lab-quality results for 40 different common blood tests in 20 minutes. Our technology enables faster, easier testing to find and treat disease earlier and at significantly lower cost. Orphidia's technology will change healthcare, expanding access to testing globally and enabling the practice of medicine to become truly information based.

jobs.title: Biomedical Scientist
jobs.description:
Orphidia is leading the development of next generation medical technology which will transform medical testing and the healthcare industry. We are developing a portable device to run all the common lab tests for liver, kidney, cardiac, thyroid, and hormone levels with results provided within 20 minutes. We now have a fast-growing, multidisciplinary team of more engineers, biologists and technicians. Orphidia is funded by well known Silicon Valley investors and is targeting rapid expansion in the US medical market through its partnerships with premier US health systems. The process of performing the most common blood tests hasn't changed in decades: once the patient visits the doctor's clinic, the test is done in a lab off premise, extending the time to diagnosis by weeks. But 1 in 3 people who die from chronic diseases every year could live longer if their disease was diagnosed earlier. Our device will change that by enabling rapid, lab-accurate, simultaneous, measurement of multiple biomarkers anywhere and anytime from a single blood drop. Orphidia's technology will change healthcare, expanding access to testing globally and enabling the practice of medicine to become truly information based.

An exciting opportunity for a talented individual with strong background in biomedical science. Reporting to the Head of Biology you will play a pivotal role within the organization helping in the development of novel assays.

Essential requirements:
• Good grade in biosciences degree and a minimum of 2 years lab experience in clinical or commercial lab focused on immunoassays
•	Enthusiasm, determination, initiative, ability to think critically and to trouble-shoot experiments, good communication and organizational skills are required.

Responsibilities:
•	Preparing solutions for chemical and biological experiments;
•	Supporting the biology team in all design experiments;
•	Documenting and maintaining up to date laboratory notebooks, with records of all experiments and their outcomes;
•	Contributing to development progress and overcoming technical problems in discussions with the core development team;
•	Contributing to the efficient functioning of the company’s facilities, including the maintenance of laboratory equipment;

Advantageous if you also have:

•	Experience working in a clinical lab
•	Experience handling human samples
•	Experience in running diagnostic assays
•	Experience of working in a clinical laboratory
•	Familiarity with ISO, GMP standards/guidelines

Job Type: Full-time

Required experience:
Clinical or Industrial Lab: 2-3 years

jobs.title: Senior Biomedical Scientist
jobs.description:
Orphidia is leading the development of next generation medical technology which will transform medical testing and the healthcare industry. Our portable device can simultaneously run all the common lab tests for liver, kidney, cardiac, thyroid, and hormone levels with results provided within 20 minutes. We now have a fast-growing, multidisciplinary team of more than 20 engineers, biologists and technicians. Orphidia is funded by well known Silicon Valley investors and is targeting rapid expansion in the US medical market through its partnerships with premier US health systems. The process of performing the most common blood tests hasn't changed in decades: once the patient visits the doctor's clinic, the test is done in a lab off premise, extending the time to diagnosis by weeks. But 1 in 3 people who die from chronic diseases every year could live longer if their disease was diagnosed earlier. Our device will change that by enabling rapid, lab-accurate, simultaneous, measurement of multiple biomarkers anywhere and anytime from a single blood drop. Orphidia's technology will change healthcare, expanding access to testing globally and enabling the practice of medicine to become truly information based.

We are looking for a key talented and driven individual to join our team. An exciting opportunity to enable further development of the bioassay technologies employed by Orphidia exists for the right candidate. The role involves a significant amount of research & interaction with cross-disciplinary teams to ensure that the chosen biochemistry is compatible with all aspects of system assembly and operation. Whilst a basic knowledge of in vitro diagnostics and system development would be useful and preferred, the bulk of experience and knowledge must lie in clinical assay development. Significant innovation will be required along with a willingness to overcome problems using technologies that you may not currently be familiar with.

The ideal candidate will also be willing to jump in and help other team mates as required. They will also be responsible for junior team members requiring mentoring and guidance of team objectives, whilst ensuring tight deadlines are consistently met.

Familiarity with standard protein assays currently used in clinical diagnostics such as immunoassays and colorimetric enzyme assays are desirable along with fluorescence microscopy. An understanding of protein stability and long term storage investigations is a significant bonus.

Essential qualifications:
•	PhD in either Biochemistry, Biomedical engineering and Molecular biology, with experience in industry.
•	Significant practical experience and theoretical knowledge of protein stability studies, microarray protein biochemistry, or immunoassay developments for clinical diagnostics.
•	Excellent laboratory practical skills particularly in the area of protein biochemistry/molecular biology techniques and experience operating and maintaining a range of advanced technological bioanalysis platforms.
•	Experience in DOE
•	Leadership experience and demonstrated ability to work within a multidisciplinary team and independently.
•	Strong communication and organizational skills.
•	Passion for and ability to understand complex multidisciplinary systems.

Advantageous if you also have:
•	Microfluidics exposure
•	Experience in running diagnostic assays
•	Experience of working in a clinical laboratory
•	Experience working with clinical laboratory analyzers
•	Familiarity with ISO 13485, FDA, GMP and GLP standards
•	ELISA

jobs.title: Senior Mechanical Engineer
jobs.description:
Orphidia is leading the development of next generation medical technology which will transform medical testing and the healthcare industry. Our portable device can simultaneously run all the common lab tests for liver, kidney, cardiac, thyroid, and hormone levels with results provided within 20 minutes. We now have a fast-growing, multidisciplinary team of more than 20 engineers, biologists and technicians. Orphidia is funded by well known Silicon Valley investors and is targeting rapid expansion in the US medical market through its partnerships with premier US health systems. The process of performing the most common blood tests hasn't changed in decades: once the patient visits the doctor's clinic, the test is done in a lab off premise, extending the time to diagnosis by weeks. But 1 in 3 people who die from chronic diseases every year could live longer if their disease was diagnosed earlier. Our device will change that by enabling rapid, lab-accurate, simultaneous, measurement of multiple biomarkers anywhere and anytime from a single blood drop. Orphidia's technology will change healthcare, expanding access to testing globally and enabling the practice of medicine to become truly information based.

The Role

We are looking for an individual with strong technical skills in mechanical design and product development. At first you will be primarily responsible for developing mechanical control and fluid control methods in conjunction with bioengineers and electrical engineers. Subsequent to this you will be responsible for developing a chassis enabling integration of microfluidics/optics/electronics subsystems. Attention to detail and creativity in your approach to both mechanical design and to fabrication methods/materials are equally important.


Candidate Profile

Candidates must possess prototyping skills (Additive manufacturing as a minimum), analytical ability, and must have a solid and demonstrated creative approach to mechanical engineering, particularly as related to biomedical product development, and preferably some understanding of microfluidics. Knowledge of material properties and their influence on fabrication is essential and an understanding of biological processes would be advantageous. A broad knowledge of novel fluid control methods at small volumes (pumps and valves) is desired, with the ability to miniaturise microelectromechanical systems. The successful candidate will also be flexible, able to respond to and contribute to a broad array of challenges both technical and non-technical. The successful candidate will need to:

•	Apply theoretical knowledge of design principles, and issues contributed by the R&D team, for solving technical problems.
•	Design system components, with understanding of how they could be translated to high volume fabrication.
•	Build proof of principle models
•	Participate in team ideation sessions with other team members and participate in periodic design reviews of projects.
•	Be accountable for the success of assigned tasks and deliverables including planning, implementation, monitoring.
•	Create/develop new test methods, statistical experiments, limited verification studies
•	Develop innovative and feasible solutions at the component & system assembly level of design for teams within the organisation as required
•	Necessary to be capable of development of detailed CAD models and drawings (e.g., Solidworks, FeatureCam or equivalent CAD packages) for internal and external manufacture.
•	Have a strong commercial focus, with strong supplier links and interactions with ODMs
•	Demonstrated leadership potential to co-ordinate and manage projects and teams.
•	Experience of working within an ISO environment (13485, 9001)


Advantageous if you also have:

•	Regulatory standards/guidelines (e.g., CE, FDA, MDD, cGMP) and/or project management training
•	Understanding of materials used in medical devices, and biocompatibility/sterility issues
•	IVD product development (biosensors, microfluidics) and interfacing of disposables with hardware.


Job Type: Full-time

Required education: Master's

Required experience:
Mechanical Engineering: 5 years

jobs.title: Software Development Lead
jobs.description:
Orphidia is leading the development of next generation medical technology which will transform medical testing and the healthcare industry. Based in London and San Francisco, Orphidia is developing a marketplace platform for on-demand lab tests. Our portable device can simultaneously run all the common lab tests for liver, kidney, cardiac, thyroid, and hormone levels with results provided within 20 minutes. Our technology enables faster, easier testing to find and treat disease earlier, saving lives and reducing medical costs. Orphidia is funded by well known Silicon Valley investors and is targeting rapid expansion in the US medical market through its partnerships with some of the leading US health systems. Orphidia's technology will change healthcare, expand access to medical testing worldwide and enable the practice of medicine to become truly information based.
 
An exciting opportunity for an individual with strong technical skills and attention to detail, to build and lead software development as part of the broader company development process. In your role you will:
 
•	Lead: You will have the chance to build and lead your own team to deliver the software requirements of the company.

•	Architect: You will be the architect designing the whole software implementation for our ground breaking medical product at all levels above firmware, to meet the FDA requirements and medical device CE marking.

•	Participate: You will be expected to be open to new ideas and processes and fully support the wider team just as they will support you.
 
Candidate Profile
The ideal candidate will have gained some experience in software development for medical system. They will be a self-starter, able to plan their own workload, whilst mentoring juniors. The candidate must also have strong attention to detail and adopt a structured approach to design, testing and validation. Meticulous documentation practice is required. Finally, they will be able to adopt a can-do attitude to suit the changing priorities in a fast paced research environment.

Essential skills
Minimum 5 years recent software development experience.
Database architectures and interface.
Programming for mobile platforms iOS and Android (language of own choice).
Application programming for desktop OS Windows and/or MacOS (language of own choice).

Beneficial skills
General understanding of embedded software and devices.
Web/app front end design experience.
Building software according to medical device quality system requirements, preferably FDA, but CE mark also acceptable. Preferably you have been significantly involved in software quality system implementation.
Experience building HIPAA-compliant software systems including HIPAA cloud infrastructure.
Interface with electronic medical records.

Personal profile
Team player but able to work independently and without supervision.
Self-starter and active contributor to the development process.
Attention to details and high quality of own work.
Software team leading experience is an advantage.

Next steps
For further information or to apply please send your CV to jobs-at-orphidia-com. 

Job Type: Full-time
Required education:
•	Bachelor's
Required experience:
•	software engineering: 5+ years
